SENT.plain: In our previous phase I study of temozolomide in patients with acute leukemia, temozolomide was well tolerated and demonstrated significant anti-leukemic activity
The maximum tolerated dose was 200 mg/m2/d for 7 days, repeated approximately every 5-6 weeks
In the current study, we evaluated the same dose of temozolomide in patients with myelodysplastic syndrome
Fourteen patients received 19 courses of temozolomide
In this study, treatment was poorly tolerated with patients requiring admission in 9 of 19 courses
Toxicity included worsening cytopenias, neutropenic fever, and exacerbation of cardiac disease, the latter due to worsening anemia
An unusual finding was the development of leukocytoclastic vasculitis in 4 patients
There were no formal responses to therapy
The current schedule of temozolomide is not efficacious in patients with myelodysplastic syndrome
